page.title: 09The Parsonage Museum(cont.)
page.content: {Parsonage Museum}has become very popular in the last ten years,largely due to a Yorkshire TV documentary.Its annual intake of visitors has risen from 80,000 to 200,000 including celebrities such as{Lady Wilson}and {Margaret Thatcher,}whilst interest in the Brontes appears to be world wide with enquiries from Korean TV and many Australian visitors. 2000 people visited the museum one Sunday in May alone.It is one of Britain's leading literary tourist attractions,second only to{Stratford {upon Avon.}But,while the Brontes may be said to have brought a measure of prosperity to what might otherwise have been an obscure Yorkshire village, the general feeling locally is that the boom in the Bronte industry has broken up community spirit and invaded privacy.There is
